content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
I received a response from the AI after running the "list_files" command with the argument "directory" set to "/path/to/directory". The command returned an empty list, indicating that the directory does not exist. This was in response to my previous attempt to execute "ls -l /path/to/directory". Additionally, I had previously attempted to replace "old text" with "new text" in the file at "/path/to/file", but the command returned a message saying that there were no matches for "old text" in the file.

I wrote a new Python script to print "Hello, World!" and executed it using the "execute_shell" command. The command returned the expected output. I also used the "google" command to search for the best places to visit in Europe and received a list of URLs in response. I then attempted to use the "get_hyperlinks" command to extract hyperlinks from a Wikipedia page, but the command returned too much output. Instead, I used the "get_text_summary" command to get an overview of Python programming language from the Wikipedia page. 

I attempted to read a file at "/path/to/file" using the "read_file" command, but it returned an error saying that the file does not exist. I then wrote "This is the text to write to the file." to the file using the "write_to_file" command and appended "This is the text to append to the file." to the same file using the "append_to_file" command. Finally, I attempted to replace "old text" with "new text" in the file using the "replace_in_file" command, but it returned a message saying that there were no matches for "old text" in the file.
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "write_to_file", "args": {"filename": "/path/to/file", "text": "This is the new text to write to the file."}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command write_to_file returned: File written to successfully.', type='action_result')]
"""
